title: US election 2020: Does climate change impact the vote?
description: Two Republicans, one Democrat and one independent voter talk about climate change.

title: Man City win Women's FA Cup after extra time
description: Manchester City win their third Women's FA Cup in four seasons as Georgia Stanway and Janine Beckie's late extra time goals beat Everton at Wembley.

title: Bristol illegal rave attended by 700 people
description: Some of the crowd became violent as they were told to leave, Avon and Somerset Police said.

title: Covid-19: English lockdown may last beyond 2 Dec, says Gove
description: Stricter rules to start on Thursday will need to bring the R rate "below 1", the cabinet minister says.

title: Celtic 90 minutes from quadruple treble after beating Aberdeen to reach final
description: Celtic are 90 minutes away from a quadruple treble after easing past Aberdeen in the Scottish Cup semi-final for their 35th domestic knock-out win.

title: Covid-19: Can my son still get married? And other questions
description: We answer some of your questions about the rapidly changing rules and restrictions in the UK.

title: Women's FA Cup Final: Valeri Gauvin equalises for Everton
description: Valerie Gauvin heads in to make it 1-1 between Man City and Everton in the Women's FA Cup final at Wembley.

title: Search for Turkey quake survivors continues
description: A survivor is pulled from the rubble in the port city of Izmir as the quake's death toll rises to 64.

title: Lockdown: Government resists calls to shut schools in England
description: Mayors of hard-hit regions are among those calling for schools to shut to reduce transmission faster.

title: Wrexham's former police station brought down with a bang
description: A controlled explosion is used to flatten a former high-rise police station to make way for a supermarket.

title: Covid lockdown: 'North worth less than South' mayor claims
description: North-west England politicians are angry at differences between local and national furlough rates.

title: Sir Bobby Charlton: England World Cup winner diagnosed with dementia
description: World Cup-winning England forward and Manchester United legend Sir Bobby Charlton is diagnosed with dementia.

title: Hamilton wins Emilia Romagna GP as Mercedes seal constructors' title
description: Lewis Hamilton moves to the brink of a seventh world title with victory in the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix.

title: Covid: Second England lockdown 'a devastating blow'
description: Some are better prepared, others will diversify businesses and several want more financial support.

title: Lockdown: 'More sports face collapse without guidance' says shadow sports minister
description: The government is urged to issue prompt guidance on how new lockdown rules for England will affect sport "unless they want more sports to face collapse".

title: Mortgage holidays extended for up to six months
description: The scheme to help borrowers facing financial difficulty had been due to end on 31 October.

title: Coronavirus: Transport for London secures emergency £1.8bn bailout
description: Transport for London has secured a six-month deal to keep services running until March 2021.

title: Australia records zero Covid-19 cases for first time in five months
description: Locally-transmitted cases have dropped to zero and one state is hopeful for a "normal Christmas".

title: Nagorno-Karabakh conflict: Human cost of two nations fighting for 'Motherland'
description: The stories of families who have lost sons in the latest territorial war over Nagorno-Karabakh.

title: How I talk to the victims of conspiracy theories
description: The BBC's specialist disinformation reporter explains how to help people who've fallen down the rabbit hole.

title: How His House turns refugee lives into horror film
description: Director Remi Weekes says film explores "the horrors that we do as humans to other humans".

title: 'My parents had hearts of gold, they didn't deserve it'
description: How people are dealing with the effects of coronavirus in one New York neighbourhood.

title: NHS 'refuses' medical cannabis for children with epilepsy
description: Families foot the bill as the NHS "refuses" to prescribe medical cannabis for children with epilepsy.

title: Covid: What will the England lockdown achieve?
description: Lockdown is the measure nobody wanted but now many European countries have decided they need.

title: Salvaged Victorian signal box to become museum
description: It became redundant in 2016 along with others in the East Midlands.

title: Match of the Day: Alan Shearer and Danny Murphy on how Diogo Jota & Xherdan Shaqiri helped Liverpool beat West Ham
description: Match of the Day pundits Alan Shearer and Danny Murphy analyse the impact of Liverpool's substitutes Diogo Jota and Xherdan Shaqiri during their 2-1 win over West Ham.
